direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) So where you wanna go?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The party's still in full gear. Ray is now chatting up a few of the groupies. Joe and Bud Lite sit off in a corner. Joe's knocked back several beers. He's a little tipsy, and lost in thought.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe's gaze falls on a sultry brunette, SHERI, at a table across the way. She's eyeing Joe big time. She wants him. He stares back at her. She doesn't blink.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Maybe she's out with some guy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who? Camille? I don't think she's the type to screw around on ya. Shoot ya, maybe...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It wouldn't be screwing around. It's not like we're going together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Camille, carrying an armload of books, comes down the library steps, having been studying late. As she heads for her dorm, she sees Joe and Sheri going across the Quad; Sheri draped around Joe, nuzzling him. Joe looks over, spots Camille, stops; surprised, embarrassed to see her. They exchange a look. Camille, upset, turns and wheels off. Joe wants to say something to her, but can't get it out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We don't know where yet, but they seem to be slipping and sliding, clutching on to each other.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're right, nobody would ever see us here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . ICE SKATING RINK - NIGHT Near closing time. Darnell and Autumn lurch and stumble around the ice, collapsing against the boards now and then. There are few other skaters at this hour.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Autumn laughs, as the house lights start to blink, indicating it's closing time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They make their way to an opening in the boards, stumble over to a bench, begin to unlace.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She laughs, looks at him a beat, starts to come forward to kiss him. He puts a finger to her lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hesitates a beat, then comes forward again. They fall into a deep kiss. We PULL BACK to LONGSHOT. Two people alone in the expanse of the ice rink. The lights flicker and go out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, I figure the key is to go places only white people go. Next time we'll go bowling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Plus I saw this in Rocky. I never believed a guy who was supposed to be an athlete would skate that bad, but now I know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks, that was fun, sort of.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You were pretty good for the first time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, it's not really my first time. My dad took me skating once.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He used to play ball for E.S.U., didn't he?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah, how'd you know that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I saw his picture on the Wall of Fame. You got his eyes. Luckily, you didn't get his thighs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Make sure you mean it this time.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Camille, unable to sleep, enters in her workout clothes. Languid, melancholy, she goes to the treadmill, as Joe comes out of the steam room with nothing but a towel around his waist. Both are surprised to see the other.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Camille just nods. Long, silent pause.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns, starts toward the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Camille hesitates, not sure whether to believe him, then gets off the bike and walks toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Camille, really steamed now, snatches the towel from around Joe's waist, leaving him naked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Camille snaps the towel at him, driving him back. Joe's totally thrown by this reaction in her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She snaps the towel again, backing him against the training table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pounds on his chest, pushing him back on the table.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He looks at her a beat, then pulls her mouth down to his. They fall into a long, white-hot kiss.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doin' here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Couldn't sleep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was just sweatin' out some of the beer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't go home with her. I thought about it... but I didn't.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You drink too much.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why didn't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why didn't I what?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Go home with her?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know... I guess I figured maybe there was somethin' goin' on between you and me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Then why'd you pick her up in the first place?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I was drunk... I needed some company.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (angry) Company? Yeh, I can see you havin' a real far-ranging discussion with Sheri.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I mean, ya know, physical company... I was... I just needed to pounce on somebody I guess.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why can't you pounce on me? Aren't I good enough to pounce on?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, you're more conservative... classier... you're not that kinda girl...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (insulted) How do you know? You've never slept with me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What makes you think she's such a great ride? (climbing up on top of him) I'm prettier, my legs are longer... (pulling down her leotard) I've got better tits. (exasperated) Why would you go to her, when you have me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't know I had you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (softer, leaning close) Well you do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Joe and Camille are making love passionately, energetically. Camille, still worked up, rolls up on top.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe rolls back on top, the momentum carrying both of them off the table and out of sight.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (between kisses) You shoulda looked for me at the library, or don't you ever go there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rolling back on top) I go there. I got a 3.2 in Political Science. I just don't go there on Saturday nights.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (rolling back on top again) I have a paper due Monday. What'de she do? Sit on your lap or just give you the nail-me stare?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shut up, Camille.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Some 100 students are taking a history test in blue books. A T.A., checking attendance, walks up to Louanne. She's uneasy as the T.A. checks his chart. T.A. What's your name?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louanne knows she's in deep trouble.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Bobby Collins. T.A. Can I see your I.D.?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A high-tech room full of video machines and monitors used to run simultaneous views of different positions during the same play. A grim-looking group of assistant coaches approaches Winters as he runs through and reprograms the images on the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winters' face goes dead.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Coach, we, ah... got a problem with Bobby Collins.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeh...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He talked... a friend... into taking a test for him and got caught. They had a new T.A. in there...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the penalty?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, the rules say automatic expulsion for both of them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fortunately, we've got friends on the Board of Regents. I think we can beat this if we really go to bat for him. We got Mack off when he turned in that other guys term paper. (shaking his head) But what kinda idiot would do something like that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, I guess Bobby figured he was gonna flunk...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't mean Bobby. I mean what kinda guy would be dumb enough to take a test for him?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Uh, well... it wasn't a guy.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: A girl? Typical Collins. He must have banged her until she couldn't think straight. Who was it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (barely able to get it out) It was... Louanne.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Winters, enraged, is venting his spleen at Louanne.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She gets up and walks out of the room. Winters closes his eyes and slumps down on the couch.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jesus, Louanne, how could you be so stupid?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: ... he was behind, he needed help. I'm sorry. I just...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sorry! You're sorry! You've destroyed my credibility at the University, my authority with the players... Christ, it looks like I'm running a dirty program. And Collins of all people! What the hell's the matter with you, Louanne?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (crying) I don't know... I thought he... loved me...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Loved you? He loves anything that winks back, the little rat bastard. And what are you gonna do for school now? I use my influence to get you back in, it'll stink to high hell. The press'll crucify me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll get in someplace.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God, Louanne, I told you to stay away from my players. That was my cardinal rule, stay away from the damn players...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They've always been good enough for you. Good enough to devote your life to. Why aren't they good enough for me? Or are they too good?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're changing the subject, Louanne. We're talkin' about you breakin' the rules.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Didn't you ever break the rules just a little? Didn't you tell me once that 90 per cent of the schools obey the NCAA rules, and the other 10 per cent go to bowl games? Was that just a joke?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Darnell sits at his table waiting for Autumn. Autumn storms in, obviously upset about something. She slaps a corrected test down in front of him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She shakes her head and walks away. Darnell's grin fades. He looks at his test, a hint of tears in his eyes. He's embarrassed and deeply worried.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You seen this? You got a D on your math test.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeh, I kinda figured that. I had some trouble on this last part...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We went over that last week, Darnell. What is this time we spend in here? Just a joke to you? I don't even think you've been listening to me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been listening to you, baby...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't call me baby. I thought you wanted to learn. But if all you wanta do is fake your way through, then get another tutor to waste time with.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: C'mon, Autumn, we just had a good time, and now you're gettin' all nuts behind this. It's just one test.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So far, it's the only test. I want you to study this whole chapter. By yourself, without me here. When I come back, we'll discuss it. Be ready to do problems based on it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Whatever you say, Teach. (big grin) I don't wish to be cast in a pejorative light, so I'm dedicating myself to achieving on a level more commensurate with my abilities.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The players are dressing for Monday practice, but it's strangely subdued. Bobby Collins opens his locker to find a BULLET-RIDDLED PRACTICE JERSEY hanging inside. Immediately the rest of the players burst into raucous laughter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Suddenly the room goes silent. Standing in the doorway is Coach Winters. He says nothing, looks around the room, the players avoiding his gaze. His eyes come to rest on Bobby. Bobby tries to hide the shirt, but Winters has seen. Winters just stares at Bobby a beat, then.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: With that, he turns and walks out the door. The players remain silent. Bobby throws the shirt in the trash.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Coach'd probably shoot ya lower.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You all played a fine game on Saturday. Take the day off.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Winters walks in the front door, past the desk, up the stairs and down the hall to his daughter's room. She's packing her things. He goes over to her, takes her in his arms and hugs her tight. Neither speak. A tear rolls down Louanne's cheek. Hits the floor.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A very nervous Bobby Collins comes down the hall and knocks on Coach Winter's door.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: C'mon in, Collins.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bobby enters and stands across from Winters' desk. Winters doesn't invite him to sit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobby does. Instantly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bobby just stands there a beat, in confusion and disbelief. There is no wavering, no sympathy in Winters' eyes. Finally, dazed and disoriented, Bobby turns and walks out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Listen, Coach, I just want you to know I'm really sorry about this whole thing with Louanne. I was real glad to hear she's gonna be goin' to junior college here...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cutting him off) Shut up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I could easily take your case to the Board of Regents. You've had no prior infractions and I could argue that you were under abnormal pressure. (pause) But I won't. You embarrassed me, you embarrassed my family, you embarrassed the program. As of now, you are no longer a member of this university or it's football team. Clean out your locker.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .S.U. CAMPUS LIBRARY - DAY Joe is posed in front of the school library, one of it's more photogenic buildings. T.V. sportscaster LYNN SWANN and his video crew wait to interview him as a MAKEUP GIRL finishes applying makeup to Joe's face. Publicist Sharon Braver watches like a hawk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An assistant marks the take, and Swann turns to Joe.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to his cameraman) We ready, Jerry? O.K., let's mark it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Joe, this game is being billed as a potential "Heisman Shootout". Did you feel any added pressure this week...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A phalanx of photographers crowd around, snapping away as Joe goes through passing drills.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) ...knowing that you're going head to head with Heisman rival, Tim Waymen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Well, ya know, you try to block it out, but it's basically impossible... Everybody seems to be talkin' about it, all the newspapers, the interviews...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: .V. STUDIO - NIGHT Joe is being interviewed by DALLAS PERRY on a local television show.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) The hype on T.V., tryin' to get somethin' goin...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sharon Braver steps directly in front of the video camera, waves off the take.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Braver takes Joe aside, talks to him confidentially.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hold it! Hold it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What?! What's the problem?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What you're saying is true, of course, but I don't think it's the message you want to send.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Joe and Camille are sharing a pizza, but not alone. A video spotlight shines on them, as yet another crew rolls tape.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) It makes you seem a little nervous. Like the pressure might be getting to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: This game is nationally televised, so most Heisman voters will be watching. I think a more casual approach is better. Modest, controlled, casual. Joe nods and heads back in front of the camera.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (to Braver, irritated) We all set now? (gets a nod) Let's mark it. (the take is marked) Joe, this game is being billed as a potential "Heisman Shootout."
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .S.U. QUAD - NIGHT A huge bonfire burns, as a large segment of the student body has gathered in front of the Timberwolf statue. The cheerleaders, all wearing "KANE IS ABLE" buttons, whip the crowd up, as Joe is introduced on the podium.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cheerleaders begin to chant, "Let's go, Joe." On "Joe", they assume the Heisman trophy pose. Joe seems slightly embarrassed by it all.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Did you feel any added pressure this week, knowing that you're going head to head with Heisman rival, Tim Waymen?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: No, I don't really think too much about that kinda thing. Swann shoots Braver a poisonous look.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe and Camille sit on a bank looking down at the railroad tracks below. Neither says anything. Joe seems strangely preoccupied. Camille decides to break the silence.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Infuriated, she slaps him across the face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She turns and storms away up the hill, as we hear a TRAIN WHISTLE. Joe watches her go, then starts down the hill toward the tracks as the train comes into view. Camille stops, turns back, sees Joe headed for the tracks, starts to worry. Joe reaches the grade and steps into the middle of the tracks facing the oncoming train. Horrified, Camille runs down the embankment toward him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: As the train approaches, it's horn blaring, Joe lies face down on the tracks, his hands gripping the railroad ties. Camille arrives at the bottom of the hill in time to see the train race over him. She falls to her knees screaming. Under the train, we see Joe desperately hugging the ground, head down, toes dug in, hands clutching the ties. It's like a tornado under there, dirt debris flying everywhere, his clothes flapping wildly. The train passes. Camille looks up, afraid to breath as Joe lies motionless on the tracks. Suddenly he stirs, pushes himself up to his knees. She lets out a scream of joy, races toward him, as he gets to his feet, stumbles off the grade. She hugs him to her, tears streaming down her face, helps him over to the embankment.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The question hangs in the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pulls her to him, kisses her hair, they slump against each other.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Your parents comin' to the game tomorrow?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My mom's dead. My dad has never seen me play.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Guess he's not that interested in football.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But you're one of the best players in the country.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (snapping) He's just not into it, o.k.?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (chastised) O.k. (silence) What's goin' on, Joe? You ask me out here, like you wanta talk about somethin', then you don't say anything. You worried about tomorrow?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No... I'm worried about the days after that. I just. I don't know... I feel like tomorrow's gonna be my last game. I want to stay up, make the time go slow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why would it be your last game? You afraid of getting hurt?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, that'd be a relief. Then, at least, I wouldn't be a failure.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Joe, why are you thinking like this? Why would you be a failure? You're having a great year, you're a Heisman Trophy candidate, you got millions of dollars waiting for you in the pros.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (testy) How do you know what's waiting for me? You don't know me at all.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (hurt) I don't know you? How can you say that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because you wouldn't be here now if you did. You only know the guy that's supposed to make millions in the pros.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Is that what you think? That I'm with you for the money?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why else?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fuck you, Joe. (starting to cry) I don't give a shit about your money. I don't even give a shit about football. And you know what? Maybe you're right, maybe I don't know you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Joe! Joe! My god, Joe, what are you doing? No! No!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: God Joe, oh god, are you allright?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (drained) Yeh, just got some dirt in my teeth. Guess you've really seen the dark side now, huh? You should've gotten out while you had the chance. Before it all goes to hell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't wanta get out, damnit. What's wrong Joe? Why would it all go to hell?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm a Kane, Camille. That's all it takes. We're cut out to be drunks and fuck-ups. We never live up to expectations. It's in our blood. My dad, brothers, uncles -- we all drink and sooner or later we all fuck up. My dad went the longest. Waited till he was playin' triple A ball, before he hit the wall. Sometimes I feel like I'm just waiting for my turn. The better I do, the closer it gets.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're not like them, you can beat all that. You can stop drinking, you can break the chain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If I gave up that, I wouldn't be much of a football player. And if I wasn't a football player, what would I be?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You'de still be Joe. And I'd still love you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Just don't say I never warned you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: and BO SCHEMBECKLER in the foreground, the jammed to capacity stadium in the background. This shot is going out on nationwide T.V., the college Game of the Week.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: :29 to go and it's been a great one. Two undefeated teams goin' after each other. Michigan up by four, 24- 20, but the lead has changed hands three times, and you get the feeling that whoever has the ball last is gonna win it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Joe brings the offense to the line of scrimmage. Yells signals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe fades to pass, looks right, looks left, can't find a receiver, decides to run for it. He sprints up the middle, 15, 10; a SAFETY comes at him at the 5. We see Joe's P.O.V. through HELMETCAM. He pushes the lunging safety away, turns back just in time to be blasted by the OTHER SAFETY he never saw. Joe is knocked down, over the goal line and out cold. The crowd goes wild.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe lies motionless as his teamates run over to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We go to Winters, worried on the sideline, as the celebration around him begins to die down.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Well, it was billed as a Heisman shootout, and it's been all of that. Both Waymen and Kane moving their teams up and down the field, having big days.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Kane back to pass, can't find anybody, gonna run it himself, ten, five, hit at the goal-line... Touchdown E.S.U.!! Great run by Kane!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) He's still down. Looks like he's hurt.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As he's carried off the field, his arms around two linemen's shoulders, and lowered onto the bench. We go to a BLURRY IMAGE of a man's face waving something. We REVERSE to REVEAL a DOCTOR waving smelling salts under Joe's nose. Joe begins to come around. The doctor holds up two fingers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How many fingers am I holding up?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Four.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Michigan comes to the line of scrimmage. As Tim Waymen gets under center, Alvin begins to yell at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Waymen begins to call signals.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ball is snapped. Waymen fakes a handoff to his fullback, hides the ball on his hip, fades to pass. On the sideline, Coach Winters yells, "Pass! Pass!" Alvin's not fooled by the run, he shakes his blocker and takes dead aim on Waymen. Just as Waymen releases the ball, Alvin blasts him, driving him into the turf.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ball, however, flies through the air, a perfect spiral. The E.S.U. secondary has been fooled by the play fake and is a step behind. The ball comes down in the hands of the Michigan tight end, JERRY HUNT.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winters slams his headphones to the ground.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, powderpuff. You're the white boy that ratted my brother out. Sent him to jail, cocksucker. Ran off with the fuckin' money. Left the blood to do the time, huh?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeh, you're the little bastard. Account of you, my bros' datin' his cell mate. You hear me, powderpuff? Gonna make you pay. You gonna be my cellmate now. You gonna have 250 lbs. of pissed-off nigger up your ass.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) E.S.U. in an eight-man line looking for the run on third and short.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Waymen fakes to Simms, Mack on the blitz, Waymen is goin for it all! Hit as he throws.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Hunt has got a step. He's got it! Touchdown!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Great clutch throw under pressure. Can't do it much better than that.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The Doctor examines Joe, shines a light in his eyes, makes him track his finger, etc.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The seven members of the BOARD OF REGENTS sit on one side of a long rectangular table, the Chairman in the middle. On the other side are coach Winters, Bobby Collins, the President of the Faculty Senate, EDWARD LEARNIHAN, Academic Advisor, ARTHUR SHANE, President of the Student Body, RICHARD FOWLER, and Galen Howard. direction.raw_text: Winters could kill this kid.

dialogue.raw_text: Therefore, I respectfully submit that Bobby Collins should not be given special treatment just because he's a football player. Would a regular student get a reinstatement hearing if they'de been caught cheating? Nobody's talking about letting the girl who took the test back in.

dialogue.raw_text: I think it's also instructive to look at some of the courses this young man has taken. Beginning Golf, Voice and Speech Improvement...

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know much about all this other stuff, but I do know the punishment should fit the crime. Cheating's bad, but I don't think it deserves a life sentence. Here's one of those athletes who takes college level courses, who wants to graduate. I think Bobby Collins made a big mistake, but he's already been suspended for several weeks. He's served his time. I think he deserves a second chance.

dialogue.raw_text: Like Alvin Mack? We gave him a second chance and since he's had 5 incompletes, 4 withdrawals and still reads at a fourth grade level. dialogue.raw_text: Gentlemen, please, let's get back to the business at hand, Bobby Collins. As you know, I played football here. And I remember how hard it was to practice and then study when you're dead tired. So I have some sympathy for this young man. But I never cheated, so the real question is his character. Since you know him better than anyone else in this room; and having talked to him and observed him over the last several weeks, do you feel he's learned his lesson? direction.raw_text: Camille's on the phone.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, my name is Camille Schaeffer. I'd like to speak to Joe Kane.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Joe is aimlessly flipping cards toward a wastebasket. A NURSE knocks on his door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe says nothing, not wanting to deal with this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The nurse leaves. Joe gets up, goes to the wall, and starts pounding it with his right hand.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You've got a phone call. A Camille Schaeffer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: She says she's your girlfriend
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't want to talk to her.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You sure?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) I'm sorry, he doesn't wish to speak to you right now. Crushed and angry, Camille hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud Lite is watching television. Louanne enters on her way to Bobby Collins' room, carrying an armload of neatly-pressed laundry. But Lite gets up to bar her way.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud just nods blankly. Louanne starts to head for Bobby's room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud doesn't have the heart to tell her. She finally realizes Bobby's with another girl.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud nods. Louanne, fighting back tears, walks back down the hall with as much dignity as she can muster.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Louanne, how ya' doin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine, Bud, ya know. Goin to J.C., hopin' to get back in here next year. Just came by to give Bobby some laundry I did for him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You two seein' each other again?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeh, he was even talking about us gettin' a place off campus together, until he got reinstated. I don't know how I woulda told my dad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah, Louanne... (pained to say it) I wouldn't go in there right now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Why not?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ah. Guess I'm pretty stupid when it comes to men. I never learn, do I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think maybe men are just stupid when it comes to you. If you ever feel like, ya know, just talkin' sometime, gettin' a beer -- let me know. My schedule's pretty open.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thanks, Bud (handing him the clothes) Give him these, will ya?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Winters comes to the door, hesitates, walks in and finds Joe huddled on his bed. Shivering.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe looks resentful but makes an effort and sits up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe gets unsteadily to his feet. He feels sick. Winters reaches out to shake hands. Joe does not reciprocate. Hides his right hand behind his body.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe doesn't move.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe is angry but he doesn't want to do anything about it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe sinks to his knees. Winters stares down at him, then kneels also, his own anger and frustration draining away.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe reveals his hand. It's barked and cut, but not badly swollen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get up. I wanta talk to you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't sit up. Stand up. If you can.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What's the matter, Joe? You won't shake hands with me. (Joe is silent) You don't want me to see your hand, do you? (more silence) So I guess what I heard was true, huh? You been poundin' the walls with your passin' hand, right? (silence) I tell you what, Joe, you want to hit somethin', hit me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I said hit me. I'm the one who put you in here. Don't hit the damn wall. It ain't the wall's fault. Hit me! Go on, hit me right now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Who else you wanta hit, huh? you're daddy maybe? Cause he's a no-show prick? Well, I'm a daddy, too, and not a very good one at that. So just hit me instead! I'll take your daddy's beatin' for him. Go on, you want to. Hit me, damnit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pushes Joe in the chest) Hit me! I'm not gonna leave you alone until you hit me. (shakes Joe by shoulders) The guys'll thank you. They've always wanted to do it. So do it now, damnit! Do it!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .K., Joe, it's o.k. I guess I need it more than you do. (pause) You gotta quit beatin' up on yourself. Let me see that hand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's o.k. (playfully) You can still throw with it, you fuckin' mook. (pause) Look, the nurses say this is the toughest time for you right now. I thought I'd stick around a little, case you wanta play some cards, pick a fight with the wall again, whatever...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You don't have to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes I do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lattimer fills a bag with all his steroid paraphernalia. He carries it to his bathroom where he slowly empties it into his toilet. Syringes, vials and bottles of pills all tumble into the water. He flushes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sun shines through the window. Joe wakes up, raises up, looks over at Winters who is asleep in a chair. Winters rouses. Joe gives him a little smile, he's allright. Winters gives him a nod of approval.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . BEGIN A SERIES OF SHOTS detailing the Timberwolves progress over the next four games.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Players shaking hands at midfield after the game. The scoreboard reads E.S.U. 14 Boston College 10.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Darnell in study hall, with his new tutor concentrating on her explanation, applying himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - DAY 3) Steve Lattimer, in street clothes, paces the sidelines, jumping up and down in frustration, his hamstring bandaged to sell the injury ruse. He catches himself, gets back on his crutches. A newspaper fades up through the shot. It reads "Wolves Offense Fires Blanks in 13-0 Loss to Texas."
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Darnell sits in a cafe, drinking coffee and studying. Ray comes in, his arm around a co-ed, MONICA. They buy a pastry and leave, not having seen Darnell. Darnell ponders this a second, goes back to studying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) A group of patients is gathered around a T.V. set in the Rehab Center, watching a pre-game show. One goes to Joe's room, where Joe's lying on his cot.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe leans back, staring at the ceiling.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Joe, don't you wanta watch the game? It's on cable.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No thanks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .V. SCREEN 6) Sportscaster DALLAS PERRY is holding forth on the local evening news.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: .S.U. on the strength of a 62 yard touchdown run by freshman Darnell Jefferson, squeaked by the North Carolina Tarheels today, 14 to 13, keeping their bowl hopes alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ) Darnell, with his books, on the way to the library, passes the frat house where the victory party is in progress. He sees Ray and Autumn walking together. Autumn sees him, her face lights up. He gives her a slight smile, keeps walking. She watches him with a certain longing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Darnell, alone in the library, late at night, studying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Lattimer, carrying his gear bag, walks into the locker room. His teammates come over to shake his hand, slap him on the back, welcome him back to the team.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . JOE'S REHAB CENTER ROOM - NIGHT Joe sits on his bed listening to the E.S.U. broadcast.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) E.S.U. hoping to get past a tough Iowa Hawkeyes team in their last game before the return of star quarterback, Joe Kane.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The E.S.U. defense is on the field. Alvin moves up opposite the OFFENSIVE GUARD.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The ball is hiked. Iowa runs a sweep left. Lattimer tries to get outside to contain, but is blocked by the fullback, who goes low and cuts his legs out from under him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alvin pursues the play as the ballcarrier heads for the corner, then suddenly cuts back. Alvin has overrun the play slightly. We go to SLOW MOTION as he turns and is hit with a wicked CRACK-BACK BLOCK by the guard he taunted. Alvin's leg flexes at a horrifying angle. We HEAR THE SNAP of bone and tendon, as Alvin plummets to the ground, writhing in pain, grabbing his left leg.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The doctor and trainers sprint out to the field.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I know you, motherfucker. You're the prick who got my little sister pregnant. We ain't seen you around lately. Where you been, huh? Answer me, motherfucker, or I'm gonna peel your cap.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shit, Lattimer...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, no...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: We move in on Joe's face, as Harvey is heard on the radio in the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe's eyes close. He knows what this means.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Oh, boy, this does not look good, Harmon. They're bringing the stretchers out...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Alvin is being strapped on the stretcher.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (wailing in pain) Oh, shit, oh shit, I'll kill that motherfucker. I'll... Oh shit...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: An ambulance carrying Alvin emerges from the stadium. We hear CHEERING inside, the SIREN outside.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Twelve seconds left, Iowa driving for the winning touchdown. Fourth and goal at the one. E.S.U. trying to hold on without their star middle linebacker, Alvin Mack.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The E.S.U. defensive line digs in. Lattimer tries to suck up his remaining strength. Iowa runs a blast to Lattimer's side. He fights through one block, the ballcarrier coming right toward him. They meet in a titanic collision at the goal line. The back keeps driving, twisting. Lattimer tries to hold him, but weaker than he was on steroids, is unable to. The back falls over the goal line. Touchdown. IOWA 13 E.S.U. 10. As the Iowa players celebrate all around him, Lattimer sits where he fell, a beaten and humiliated young man.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Coach, you've lost two of your last four.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Coach Winters faces the press.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Why do your teams seem to nose dive at the end of the last couple seasons?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This was a tough loss, but this ain't any nose dive. We've had some key players out, but if we win next week, we'll still win the conference and go to a major bowl on New Year's Day. I mean, I know you guys can't write, but I thought you could at least count.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Alvin lies on a bed, his leg bandaged and elevated. He's still a little groggy from anesthetic. Coach Winters stands beside him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Several beats of silence. Then:
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alvin nods. Winters comes forward, hugs him around the head, gives him a smile, walks out. Tears brim in Winters eyes as he leaves. Alvin's head goes back against the pillow. Tears aren't brimming here. They're rolling down his cheeks.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You look good, Alvin.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeh, I feel o.k.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any of the guys been down yet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They called.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hell, you know how football players are about hospitals and injuries.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeh.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm never gonna play again, am I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Doctors aren't always right, Alvin... but I just want you to know... you're the best defensive football player I ever coached.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . REHAB CENTER - MORNING Joe walks out with his suitcase. Coach Winters waits for him. Shakes his hand. They get in the car.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Congratulations. I'm proud of you, Joe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: I know you had a difficult time. Michigan is easy, right? Bourbon is tough.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They share a laugh. Winters pulls out two sets of round trip airline tickets.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe takes the tickets, just looks at him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Scotch.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got somethin' for ya. Coupla round trip tickets. Go see your dad. Get it cleaned up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (on the phone) I'm gonna have to take a test with the coach right there. You sure you got somethin' better than blockers?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Lattimer hangs up, picks up a HYPODERMIC. Stares at it a second, sweat beading on his forehead. Then plunges it an inch deep into his thigh. Pulls it out, sits on the bed a beat, then picks up a barbell and begins to pump it furiously, biceps bulging.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Much better. This guy is foolproof. See ya Saturday.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . COACH WINTER'S OFFICE - AFTERNOON The coach is facing Ray and Darnell across his desk.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray is stunned, Darnell elated, but neither says a word.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I wanta do something different for this game. Try to maximize our speed, but keep you both in the lineup at the same time. Ray, I'm moving you to fullback. Darnell, you're startin' at tail.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ray, you'll be carrying the ball less and blocking more, but they'll still have to respect your running and pass-catching ability. Not everybody can make a transition like this. You think you can handle it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (tight lipped) Yes, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good. We can't afford any hang dogs.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Camille comes off the court, after tennis practice. She's surprised to find Joe waiting for her.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She starts to walk away, heading for the bike racks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Camille gets on her bike...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: and pedals off.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She just keeps on going.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hello, Camille.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (cool) Hello, Joe. You allright now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeh... yeh, I think so.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good, I'm happy for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Camille, hold on, O.K.? I'm sorry that I didn't want... that I couldn't see you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You couldn't even talk to me. What happened to "there's somethin' goin' on between you and me"?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: C'mon, Camille, I was embarrassed. I couldn't...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting after her) I couldn't understand why anybody would wanta talk to me. Camille!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A bus comes up the hill toward us, on the main street of Joe's sooty, little home town, the huge stacks of moribund steel works filling the sky in the background. The bus stops at a corner. Joe steps off. No bag. He's not planning on staying long.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe goes to the front door. Knocks, gets no answer, pushes the door open, walks through the messy, cluttered house to the back porch. Seated in a metal folding chair, smoking a cigarette, looking out at the yard is Joe's DAD. He's got a couple days growth of beard, and although not drunk now, he has the look of one.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe nods sadly.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They give each other a short, quick hug. Nothing sentimental. Joe walks back through the house. His dad stares out at the yard.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: How ya doin', Dad?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (surprised to see him) Joe! What's this? They throw you out?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I heard about your little set-to. They had it on the news here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeh, they sent me to rehab.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We know what that's worth. Your brother's been through it three times.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So what are you doin' here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've been thinking about some things, Dad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That's what that damn rehab'll do. Make you think about a lotta things you can't do nothing' about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I kinda been wonderin' why you never came to any of my games. All those years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I don't know. I guess I didn't wanta make you nervous. You mighta tried too hard and screwed up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or I mighta done real well. Which woulda been harder on you, Dad?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (sensing the anger) What do you mean?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Mighta made you feel bad. Like maybe it wasn't written someplace that we all gotta go on our ass. Like maybe you coulda done somethin' more, if you'de tried a little harder.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Or maybe I didn't wanta see you gettin' all excited, all pumped up with pride, when I knew one day it would all come crashin' down. Just like it did.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I think I spent the last couple years hopin' I'd die before that day. But you know what Dad? That day came and I'm still here. And I got one more game this year. I don't know how well I'll play or even how much, but I want you there.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: How would you feel introducing your drunk dad to all your friends? You think about that?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I could live with it, if you could. (handing him a ticket) Here's a ticket. Section 2, Row 6. Fifty yard line. If you don't come, I'll never ask you again.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .K., Joey. And good luck.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Darnell is up late again, studying at one of the tables. He hears footsteps, becomes aware of the presence of another person. He looks up to see Autumn.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Silence. Darnell looks back at his books.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darnell gets up and pulls her to her feet. He hugs her.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hey, Autumn. How's Ray?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't know. Haven't seen him since the night I saw you. He'd been goin' out.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Monica Lambert.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You knew? Why didn't you tell me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Didn't wanta win you over that way.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I just wondered how your studying was comin'. You ready for tomorrow?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The test? I hope so. I been workin' pretty hard.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Good... (sitting down) I talked to my dad last night.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, yeah? How's he doin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Fine. We talked about you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What did you say?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (eyes brimming) I told him I'd gone out with you... I told him I wished I could still go bowling.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . EXAMINATION ROOM - AFTERNOON Darnell is bent over his test booklet. He writes furiously, stops to think, starts writing again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe takes a snap, fades to pass, throws an out. The ball flutters badly, falling short.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The players, surprised at this turn of events, begin to file off. Even the coaches are baffled. Winters walks over to Joe, who has no idea what this is about.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He's rusty. I doubt if we can start him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (simmering) He's worse than that. He's outa shape. (blowing his whistle) All right, that's enough for today. Practice is cancelled. Everybody off the field, but Kane. (the players hesitate) C'mon what the hell are you standin' around lookin' at? Get outa here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Didn't do much while you were in there, did ya?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we didn't exactly have a team...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You could've worked out on your own.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I had some other things to worry about...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Well, we're gonna make up for lost time. We'll start by hoppin' the steps.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hoppin' the steps?! What, you're gonna punish me now.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't talk back to me, Joe. I'll kick your ass. I went easy on you, 'cause you had to get through detox, but that's out to sea now. You let this team down; you let this program down. Start those steps. Right leg.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - STADIUM Hopping up the stadium steps on his right foot, laboring as he passes Winters, halfway up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe switches to his left foot and continues hopping up the steps, his quadriceps bursting with pain.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Now the left.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: - LATER - STADIUM hanging by his arms, moving hand over hand along the crossbar of the goalpost, panting with fatigue, Winters watching from below.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: - AT SUNSET - STADIUM Bone weary now. Winters has him run 20 yards, get down and do 10 pushups, run another 20 yards, do 10 more pushups etc. Joe staggers the 20 yards, drops to do his pushups, can only do 4. Winters yanks him to his feet, pushes him forward to run again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winters pushes Joe down to do his pushups. Joe has to strain mightily to do two.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe tries to get up, but collapses face down on the turf, as Winters continues to walk away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: guys. 70 guys who busted their butts all year. Because of you they might not win the conference. Because of you they might not go to a bowl.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (barely able to stand) I didn't wanna leave... I just screwed up...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You dogged on them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (stopping, exhausted) No, no I never dogged. I worked my ass off. I played hard...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pushing him forward) Then you shoulda stayed in shape. Keep runnin', dammit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (wobbling, starting to break down) I always played hard. I gave my everything for you. When you came to the Center, I thought you were really worried about me. But you don't give a shit. We're all just a buncha sled dogs. If you had another guy who could throw, you'da left me in the fuckin' hospital. (falling to his knees, sobbing) The only thing that matters is the program, the god-damn program.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Nobody forced you to play football, Joe. Not me, not the program, nobody. But when you sign on, you commit yourself to pay the price, to do whatever it takes. Well, you haven't paid the price yet. You still owe this team. You owe this team big- time. (walking away) Get a shower.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Lattimer lies on a table, a CATHETER TUBE going into his side. A DOCTOR'S AIDE supervises. Lattimer's dealer is there.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What's this doin?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Takin' doped urine outa your bladder and puttin clean back in. Call it an oil change.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Coach Winters watches unknowingly as Lattimer pees the catheterized urine into a cup.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . LOCKER ROOM - JUST BEFORE THE GAME The team is gathered around. Conspicuous among them is Lattimer, who's painted his face like a skeleton. Coach Winters is whipping them up with a pre-game rant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Pumped to the gills, the E.S.U. team explodes in yells and races out into the tunnel. The YELLING continues OVER and mixes with the CHEERING OF THE CROWD as:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Gotta get it done today, boys. Gotta ring that bell. 60 minutes. 60 minutes of mean. No prisoners. No mercy. Nothin' but snot bubbles. Gotta ring that bell, gotta ring that Championship bell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (shouting) Ding Motherfucking Dong!!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (V.O.) Wolves movin' left to right on your radio dial. Looking to generate some offense. They've been up and down the last few weeks.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: in the huddle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They break and the E.S.U. offense comes to the line. Collins calls signals. We go to SLOW MOTION as he fades to pass. Darnell fakes a block, then rolls out for a screen pass. Georgia Tech's defensive line comes hard. Bobby flips the ball over the charging defenders. Darnell catches it, gets a good block from Bud Lite, then tucks in behind Ray who is out ahead blocking. There's only one linebacker to beat and Darnell will be into the secondary. Figuring Ray will block the guy, Darnell begins to look for the safeties. Ray, however, barely brushes the linebacker, who doesn't even break stride. He lowers his head, and drives into Darnell, his helmet hitting the football. Fumble! There's a scramble. The Yellow Jackets free safety comes up with it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thunder right. On go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The crowd and the E.S.U. bench, quickly deflated, sit back down. Darnell gets to his feet, glares at Ray, but says nothing. He knows Ray tanked the block.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alvin sits alone in the "living room", listening to the E.S.U. game on the radio, his leg propped up on an apple crate. His mother mends a pair of jeans in the b.g.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alvin's mother looks to see if there's any reaction from Alvin. There's none.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) So the Wolves defense has held after the fumble, and the Yellow Jackets will opt for the field goal. Around a 34 yarder. Ball is down, it's away, it's long enough. And good! Georgia Tech jumps out on top 3-0.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Bobby Collins fades back to pass, is rushed, throws a quick sideline, but it's a little short. The Yellow Jackets' CORNERBACK sprints up, intercepts it and runs 30 yards down the sideline for a touchdown.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Collins back to pass, rushed, now fires out in the flat. It's picked off by Hill. Down the sideline. He's gonna go in untouched. Touchdown, Georgia Tech.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .S.U. LOCKER ROOM - AFTERNOON A discouraged bunch of E.S.U. players drag into the locker room. Some swear, some bang their lockers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darnell marches over to Ray's locker.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Infuriated, Darnell goes for Ray, and they start swinging. Darnell tackles Ray, they roll on the floor, still swinging, trying to beat the shit out of each other. Finally, several players manage to pull them apart. Coach Winters charges over.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winters walks over to a table set up with 75 cups of Orange Juice and Gatorade. He swipes the cups off the table creating a small flood on the floor. Then turns the table over. The players are shocked. They've seldom seen him like this.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winters walks away, as the players are left to contemplate their mistakes. Winters goes over to Joe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe nods, excited but uncertain. Winters moves on to Ray Griffen.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: C'mon guys, we're only down ten. Let's get our fuckin' shit together.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You missed that block on purpose, didn't you, asshole.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're full of shit. You fumble, you try to blame me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's Autumn isn't it? That's what this is all about.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The hell with Autumn. You just can't take a hit.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't tell me who started it. I don't care. All I care about is this football team. We win together. We lose together. So whatever your problem is, get over it. I don't want any more of this shit. Understand?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes, sir.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As for the rest of you guys. Here's what I think of the way you played.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (pointing toward the Yellow Jackets' locker room) They're laughin' at you over there. Makin' plans for the evening. They never dreamed it'd be this easy. You guys are nothin' but bugs splattered on their windshield. You better stock up on potato chips, 'cause you're gonna be watching a lotta T.V. on New Years Day.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get warm, Joe. You're startin' the second half.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: By the way... don't let me see you miss anymore blocks.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The E.S.U. players return to their bench for the start of the second half, gather in a circle. Joe looks up in the stands to the seat he reserved for his father. It's empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Joe takes the snap from center, fumbles it, falls on it.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Joe looks to throw over the middle, waits too long, is sacked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Joe underthrows Darnell coming out of the backfield.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Clayton approaches Winters on the sideline.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Joe's too tentative, too cautious out there. He seems flat. Maybe we oughta give Collins another shot.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Joe just needs to get the feel back. He'll be allright.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Sam, we can't afford to wait...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (snapping) I said he'll be allright.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As he starts off the bench for the field, Coach Winters comes up to him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: :51 to go. Georgia Tech up 10 to nothing. The Wolves are gonna have to find some offense in a hurry here. Their defense has been keepin' them in it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Joe, I know that Rehab was good for you. Got rid of a lotta bad habits. But what about the rest of you? What happened to the Joe Kane that used to take command of this team, the Joe Kane these guys i'd run through a bulldozer for? They put him out with the trash? What are you waitin' for, somebody to feel sorry for you cause you've had some problems? Nobody in this stadium gives a shit. It's time to step up, Joe. Time to sit at the head of the Table.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .S.U. OFFENSIVE HUDDLE As Joe comes into the huddle. He's all business now.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe brings the offense to the line of scrimmage, yells "Go!" The ball is snapped, Joe drops back, hits Darnell on the sideline. First down. In quick succession, we see Joe:
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: All right, we've held these guys up long enough. Give me time back here, and I'll rip 'em apart. 16 shift, green, bolt. First sound.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: ) Complete a 15 yarder to Ray over the middle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ) Fades to pass, is rushed. Forced out of the pocket, scrambles for his life, manages to get down to the 4 yard line. He gets up, surveys the distance to pay dirt.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Nice bit of scrambling by Kane to get it to the four, but it's gonna bring up fourth and goal. No doubt about it, with 3:45 they've gotta go for it here, if they're gonna get back in this game.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Winters puts his arm around Ray who will take the play into the huddle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winters gives Ray a shove and he runs onto the field. Ray is upset, angry. He swears to himself.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Give it to me up the gut, Coach. They've been ignoring me. I know I can score.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No, we're gonna go with the sweep.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Ray enters the huddle, whispers in Joe's ear.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The team breaks out, comes to the line. Joe looks over the defense, screams signals as the CROWD NOISE is building. We go to SLOW MOTION as the ball is snapped. Ray takes one step forward then turns right, leading the play. Joe pitches to Darnell who follows Ray. Georgia Tech's outside linebacker comes up to stop the play. Ray stumbles before he can make the block. He drops out of our picture.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darnell is forced to go wider toward the sideline. The linebacker and cornerback are closing, both have the angle on him. Darnell starts to cut back. He lowers his shoulder to take the linebacker's blow. Suddenly, out of nowhere, Ray reappears and throws a devastating block on the linebacker, knocking him back into the cornerback, taking them both out. Darnell cuts it up and blasts over the safety at the goal line. Touchdown, E.S.U. The stands erupt. It's the first thing they've had to cheer about all day. Winters just looks at the clock, goes over to talk to his defense. Darnell foregoes his touchdown dance. He runs over to Ray, grabs him by the helmet.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Ray smiles. They butt heads and run off the field
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Thunder right. On 2.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Monster block, man. Monster motherfuckin' block.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: (softly to himself) All right, defense. Let's get evil. Kill 'em all, let the paramedics sort 'em out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Georgia Tech has the ball. They break their huddle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Georgia Tech quarterback fakes to his fullback, hands off to his TAILBACK on the countertrap. The tailback runs behind his big, pulling tackle, both right at Lattimer. Lattimer takes on the tackle, sheds his block. The back lowers his head, starts to power into Lattimer. Lattimer lets out a fierce yell. Smash! Lattimer explodes into the tailback, the collision lifting the back off the ground, whiplashing his neck, vibrating his helmet. Lattimer's legs churn, driving the tailback back and into the ground. We see the back's face. There are snot bubbles in his nose. No first down. No way. Lattimer jabs both arms in the air. The crowd goes nuts, as the defense slaps helmets, and runs off the field, windmilling their arms, whipping up the crowd.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: :11 and counting. Third and one. The Wolves have got to stop them on this play if they're gonna get the ball back. A first down here and it's all she wrote. E.S.U. is out of timeouts.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Winters congratulates the defense as it comes off the field. He meets Lattimer, looks into his eyes. Sees the steroids there. He knows it's the only way the kid could have done it. Decides not to bust him. Lattimer knows it. Winters gives his helmet a little slap, more in sympathy than praise.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He catches the snap, boots the ball away. Darnell fields it at his 12, starts toward the right sideline, where hemmed in, he looks like dead meat. Suddenly, he reverses his field, racing for the opposite sideline, where a picket line of blockers awaits him, if he can get there. He turns on the jets, barely beating two tacklers to the corner, and then turns it up the left sideline, picking up a wicked series of crack-back blocks, until he's finally run out of bounds at the Yellow Jacket 35 yard line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The E.S.U. fans are on their feet. Winters races over to Joe.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Time for 2 plays. If it's not open in the end zone, take the sideline. As the offense runs onto the field, Winters checks the scoreboard. 17 seconds left. Georgia Tech 10. E.S.U. 7.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Joe brings the Wolves up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe takes the snap, drops to pass, finds no one, rolls away from the rush. Just as he's about to go out of bounds, he fires a bullet down the sideline. Ray Griffen catches it and goes out of bounds at the twelve.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Ball on the Yellow Jacket 35. 17 seconds left. Kane barking signals.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Joe runs over to Coach Winters, knowing they have no more time outs, as the refs move the chains.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Field goal here ties it, but a tie may not get the Wolves into a bowl. Tough decision for Winters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (to Joe) You want me to send in the kicking team or you think you can handle it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Give me the ball.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: .K., let's do 24 inside slot, left blue lightning.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Joe races back out onto the field and into the huddle, as the crowd's roar goes off the charts.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He starts the wolf howl. The others join in, howling for all they're worth, eleven jacked-up warriors. They clap and break the huddle. The crowd is standing, waving fists in unison toward the Georgia Tech end zone. Joe looks up in the stands again at the seat he left for his father. It's still empty.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe starts to call signals as Bud Lite sings "Bali Hi." We go to SLOW MOTION as the ball is snapped. The Georgia Tech defense fires off the line, throwing everything at Joe. Joe drops back five steps. Bud Lite picks up a blitzing linebacker, knocks him over a fallen player. Joe looks for Darnell in the corner, but another pass rusher breaks through, forcing Joe out of the pocket. It's wartime as tackles and blockers collide, hand-fight, go down, scramble up, collide again, all in pursuit of Joe. Darnell, realizing Joe's in trouble, breaks off his pattern and heads to the center of the end zone. Joe dodges one tackler, shakes free of another's ankle tackle, heads back for the center of the field. He spots Darnell breaking between defensive backs. Just as he's buried by two massive linemen, Joe fires a rocket down the middle toward the sliver of open space that Darnell is heading for. The ball barely clears the hands of a lunging linebacker. Darnell and two defensive backs, one from each side, close on the ball as it cuts through the air, a perfect spiral. Darnell dives. The two defensive backs dive. The ball passes between their outstretched hands by a fraction of an inch, landing in Darnell's. He clutches it to his chest, rolls over, holds the ball up for the ref to see. Touchdown! This time Darnell does go into his touchdown dance.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (in huddle) O.K., 24 inside slot, left blue lightning. Let's put the women and children to bed, and go lookin' for fuckin' dinner. On 2.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This one's for you, Dad.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Pandemonium. The crowd including Autumn and her dad goes crazy. Winters just gives a few quick nods, watching almost wistfully as the players and coaches hug each other, knowing none of them will hug him. Joe, Bud and the others mob Darnell.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Alvin listens to the celebration a few beats, then switches off the radio, knowing this is an experience he'll never be a part of again. We leave him staring off into an uncertain future.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Chancellor and his guests are celebrating the victory, congratulating each other. Conspicuous among them are the Fat Cat Alumnus who gave Darnell the money, and the Chairman of the Board of Regents.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Fat Cat Alumnus goes to a replica of the Building Fund football field and starts advancing the ball.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This brings applause all around.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Looks like the Timberwolves are back. Probably brought the library with them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hope so. (turning to Galen Howard) Give my sincere congratulations to Coach Winters.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He'll be delighted.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: touchdown!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: As Darnell comes off the field, Autumn runs out and hugs him, leads him to her dad.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Darnell reaches into his helmet and takes out a sweat-stained piece of paper.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Daddy, you remember Darnell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . HALEY Yes, I do. Great catch, Darnell.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Thank you, sir. I got somethin' for you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My entrance exam. Got a 92. Coach Winters said you got an 87. He looked it up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: . HALEY (laughing) I'll kill him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: walking toward the tunnel, acknowledging the plaudits of the fans. He looks for Camille, doesn't see her. Coach Winters comes up next to him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Winters gives him a quick, but firm hug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Joe manages a weary smile.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hell of a throw, Joe. Good to see you back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And don't worry about the Heisman. We'll gear up for it next year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: coming down the tunnel, Bobby Collins next to him. Both stop as Louanne walks toward them. Bobby smiles to himself in anticipation of her fawning over him. She walks right by him and up to Bud.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Bud smiles. Bobby quickly looks around for someone else to hit on, hails a cheerleader. Bud and Louanne walk off together. Louanne stops when she sees her father, fearful of his reaction.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louanne waits, not sure whether her father's angry or not.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Louanne smiles. Winters returns it, and walks away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You still feel like gettin' a beer?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's not a football player any more. He's graduating this year.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: He's still got a bowl game.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: So make sure he doesn't violate curfew.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Sitting on the bench, his head in his hands, weeping.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: These are not tears of joy, but a man/boy who knows he'll never be able to play pro football without steroids.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) An amazing conclusion to a great season. We can see Steve Lattimer down on the bench weeping tears of joy as E.S.U. goes back to a bowl for the first time in three years.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .S.U. CAMPUS - LATE AFTERNOON Joe sits on a bench at the intersection of four converging Quad paths. Camille approaches from the opposite direction, stops when she sees Joe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: This softens, relaxes her a bit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Camille's shocked that he might be drinking again. He pulls a six pack of 7-Up out from behind his back. She laughs in spite of herself. They settle again.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They look at each other a beat, come forward into a long kiss and embrace as we pull up and back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: What are you doin' here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Waitin' for you. I figured you'de have to come through here on your way to dinner.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Shouldn't you be out celebrating? You played real well.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I need your help with somethin'. I know I'm not your favorite guy right now, but it's all startin' again. The expectations, the pressure, the talk about the Heisman next year. I was wonderin' if you'de like to go somewhere, maybe share a six-pack with me?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I miss you, Camille. I don't like bein' without you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'll think about it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: . STADIUM TUNNEL - DAY Coach Winters, flanked by Humes and Clayton, walks down the tunnel to a waiting car. No effigy this time.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They continue down the tunnel toward a new recruiting season, another year in the annals of The Program.
direction.name: direction

result.heading: CREDITS BEGIN TO ROLL AS EXT

dialogue.raw_text: Tickets are in your coat. Itinerary and player profiles in the briefcase. We got a 9:00am tomorrow in Baltimore with the kid from Park. Then we're on to...
dialogue.name: dialogue
